p: The findings of two previous studies of long-term outcomes after avian influenza A(H5N1) virus infection were generally consistent with our findings for A(H7N9) survivors. A follow-up study of two patients with pneumonia caused by A(H5N1) virus infection demonstrated a slow resolution process of lung radiological leisons [21]. A four-year follow-up study of one A(H5N1) patient who survived severe pneumonia reported normal pulmonary function and improved lung compensation function although lung abnormalities persisted in CT scans [22].
